messages: 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:04): Phillip` are you the Phillip of http://fonts.philip.html5.org/ fame?

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:06): I‚Äôm interested in whether this tool can include the modifiable M+ fonts http://bit.ly/mplus as font subsetting for 350KB Japanese fonts would make them actually usable
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:10): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f, yeah, that's the same Philip`
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:10): Found his email and sending that way just in case
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:11): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: I'm enjoying the weather today
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:11): you at home in Osaka?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:11): 350KB Japanese font without subsetting plus Safari not displaying anything on load = noticeable render delay even on hikari
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:11): Philip` is in the UK, so might not be on until 2-3 hours from now
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:12): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: yeah, the Safari behavior for rendering of pages with downloadable fonts is suboptimal
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:12): yeah it‚Äôs fantastic down here too. I‚Äôll be up May 15-16th for John Allsopp‚Äôs workshop tho. If you‚Äôre not busy it‚Äôd be great to catch up then
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:13): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: try http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/doctype
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:13): I plan to email the webkit list about it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:13): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: I'll be in Australia from May 8 to May 22
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:14): I think I'll see John there on the 13th before he comes ehre
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:14): aah that sucks (well, for me ;-)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:14): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: me and 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f was just talking about webkit rendering of pages with downloadable fonts
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:14): e.g., page like http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/doctype
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:15): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: do we do it wrong?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:16): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: just that you basically get no next at all while the font is downloading

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:17): I know the current HTML5 spec doesn‚Äôt recommend browser behavoiur atm, and laying out with local font then redrawing is kinda FOUCy for small fonts, but for double-byte (350KB+) fonts no text until download finishes looks like the page is broken
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:17): so on b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9's site, which uses some relatively big fonts, there's no text content for quite a while

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:18): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: hmm, is http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/doctype the right url? I don't see any references to downloadable fonts there
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:18): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: right -- that's the problem. casual users are going to assume its's a browser bug
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:18): I only used @font-face for the <h1> here (dark green band) http://oli-studio.com/work/wde/200905-roadshow/ but there‚Äôs still a noticeable delay
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:18): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: but yeah, I saw someone complain about that - not sure if there's a bug filed
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:19): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: open Web Inspector on http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/doctype and look at the Resources tab

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:19): FF 3.5 beta renders the text using a local font first then redraws. This would also be much safer if the font doesn‚Äôt finish downloading (eg server times out)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:19): 5MB+ of fonts there
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:19): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: test-quirks.php and spacer.gif
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:19): 5MB? I feel like small fry :D
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:20): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: ah, I see - I didn't notice that I got auto-completion of the url, and was looking at another page
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:21): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc is a webkit developer
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:21): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: he‚Äôs waiting for something to display‚Ä¶ ;-)
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:21): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: not one having anything to do with fonts though

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:23): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: props to the Webkit team for all the fun goodies you‚Äôre giving us! and where do I go to complain about tabs not being maintained automatically between sessions? ;-)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:23): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: there's a way you can save them manually at least
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:23): "Reopen all windows from last session"
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:24): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: as a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 says, it's a feature - but it's in Safari, not in WebKit, of course
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:24): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: yeah I know, but I‚Äôve had to pull previous versions of LastSession.plist out of git several times so far
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:25): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: damn, foiled again!
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:26): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: is Safari 4b feature complete?
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:26): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: no announcements were made, as far as I know
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:27): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: I guess I shouldn‚Äôt assume you have the inside track on what webkit build the Safari team will roll with huh
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:31): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcple engineers cannot discuss anything like that :D
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:33): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: in general if 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcple has not announced it, we can't discuss it

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:33): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: actually I came across something else a while back that I didn‚Äôt know what to make of in Webkit: Japanese text 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcpearing to break out of it‚Äôs inline box when Hoefler Text is assigned: http://oli-studio.com/code/font-set-inline-box.html
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:33): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: filing a bug at bugs.webkit.org would be great :D
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:33): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: heh, indeed. It‚Äôs part of Apple‚Äôs charm
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:34): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: hey, at least we do our development publically
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:34): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: for the purposes of engine development the "webkit team" == Apple :D
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:34): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: yeah I think that was next on the list of things to do, right before Christmas attacked
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:37): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: ah, you're talking about the top overflow?

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (08:38): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: try Apple Chancery - I think it may break out even more. likely a known issue, but filing a bug is the best way to reach people who work on text rendering
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:39): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: ok. I‚Äôll do that for both issues
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:39): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: and link in your testcase -- we love testcases
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:39): I kinda went overboard on that one huh
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:39): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: bugs are vastly more likely to be fixed with a reduced testcase
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:40): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: vs. entire bug content being "japanese text overflows with the Hoefler Text font"
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:40): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: i'm guessing the font is giving "interesting" metrics to us
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:40): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: ok. I‚Äôll make a reduced version and link it from the fat version
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:41): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: even your current version is vastly better than what we normally get
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:41): so i'd initially file a bug that links to that url
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (08:55): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: already filed https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=25207
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (09:16): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: "if the user agent has not fired a timeupdate event at the element in the past 15 to 250ms" -- s/15 to // ?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:17): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: UAs are allowed to do it every 15ms
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (09:17): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: yes, but if it hasn't fired it in hte past 250ms, then it won't have fired it in the past 15ms either
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (09:18): oh wait
